pr_title: rpc exceptions now output a limited 256 bytes of message

timeline.message:
rpc exceptions now output a limited 256 bytes of message

 - renamed SimpleOffsetSszEncoder to DefaultRpcPayloadEncoder

 - added a round trip encoder to demonstrate the same message that is encoded comes out of the decoder.

 - Added log message for decode failure.

partially addresses #2078

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: nit: shouldn't we be casting to (Bytes) here since the clazz is Bytes.class anyway? or does the compiler not allow that? or lastly is that just unnecessary?
timeline.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: we're basically bypassing the decoder if its already bytes. the compiler wasn't happy! This is the other half of the encode bypass basically. If we don't bypass it here, then we attempt to go and decode it, and it fails.
replies.author: rolfyone
cemozerr

replies.bodyText: No because the compiler doesn't know that T is Bytes.  We do because we can make the leap from Class<T> clazz being equal to Bytes.class to knowing that T is Bytes but the compiler can't.
replies.author: ajsutton
